SO BY 9:00 10:00 IN THE MORNING WE MAY SEE SOME LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS, LOTS OF CLOUD COVERAGE OUT THERE, SO JUST EXPECT MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ALL DAY ON YOUR FRIDAY PART OF YOUR SATURDAY AS WELL. A FEW POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINS IMPACTING OUR AREA. WE COULD GET A BREAK OF THE RAIN AFTER 12:00 IN THE AFTERNOON, ACCORDING TO THIS MODEL, AND OTHER MODELS ARE AGREEING WITH IT AS WELL. AND THEN WE’LL SEE ANOTHER ROUND FOR SOME RAINS. STEADY RAINS, A FEW POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINS THAT MAY LEAD TO STREET FLOODING AS WELL. AND THEN WHEN YOU WAKE UP AT FIVE, SIX, 6:00 IN THE MORNING, STILL RAINING OUT THERE AND A FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT TOMORROW, SHOWERS AROUND TEN 11:00 IN THE MORNING. JUST A VERY SOGGY START ON YOUR SATURDAY AND THEN THE FRONT WILL BE CLEARING US OUT COMPLETELY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. THEN ON SATURDAY EVENING, JUST A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS AND WE’LL SEE MORE CLOUDS BUILDING IN THEN CLEAR SKIES. EVENTUALLY OVERNIGHT ON SATURDAY. SO STORM IMPACTS FOR TODAY AND PART OF YOUR SATURDAY WILL BE HEAVY RAINS AND STEADY RAINS OUT THERE. GUSTY WINDS UP TO 30MPH. THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES AND LOCALIZED FLOODING. NOT EVERYONE WILL SEE SOME POUNDING ON THE ROADWAYS. WINDS RIGHT NOW UP TO 22MPH. VERY GUSTY DOWN INTO BOCA AND BOYNTON BEACH. CLOSE TO 25. WE ARE GOING TO SEE THAT WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT STARTING AT 12:00 UNTIL TOMORROW NIGHT. THAT MEANS WINDS OVER 30MPH IN OUR COASTAL AREAS. TEMPERATURES NOW IN THE 60S AND THE LOWER 70S. IT WILL STAY THAT WAY PRETTY MUCH ALL DAY LONG. TEMPERATURES NO LOW TO MID 70S AND IMPACT WEATHER ALL DAY. SO MAKE SURE YOU PACK THAT UMBRELLA ON YOUR FRIDAY AND PART OF YOUR SATURDAY. YOUR SEVEN DAY FORECAST. WE’LL SEE DRIER CONDITIONS SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND YOUR SUNDAY LOOKS PERFECT WITH A LOT OF SUNSHINE. A LITTLE BIT COOLER. TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE 50S. IN THE LOWER 60S WHEN YOU WAKE UP SUNDAY MORNING, AND THEN MILDER ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. Updated: 12:07 PM EDT Mar 22, 2024 Malcolm Shields Digital Content Producer Because of inclement weather, facilities and events across the Palm Beaches and the Treasure Coast on Friday are closed, canceled or postponed. The village of Palm Springs announced Friday its Easter Egg Hunt scheduled for this weekend was rescheduled to 10 a.m. Saturday, March 30.The St. Lucie County government announced Friday the Mobile Rec and Roll event at Lawnwood Skate Park in Fort Pierce was canceled.The Boynton Beach Police Department's Kids versus Field Day scheduled for Friday was postponed and is expected to be held on a to be determined date this summer.The city of Jupiter's "Touch a Truck Spring Fling" even was canceled.The city of Palm Beach Gardens' open swim on Friday was canceled, while the courts at the tennis and pickleball center are also closed. Below is a list of all facilities that are closed because of inclement weather: PGA National Softball Open swim and splash pad Lilac pickleball Courts Gardens Park Showcase Field Gardens District Park MultipurposeTop HeadlinesStay up-to-date: The latest headlines and weather from WPBF 25 Get the latest news updates with the WPBF 25 News app. You can download it here. PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla. — Because of inclement weather, facilities and events across the Palm Beaches and the Treasure Coast on Friday are closed, canceled or postponed.
Potential for heavy rain, localized flooding and gusty winds Friday Advertisement The village of Palm Springs announced Friday its Easter Egg Hunt scheduled for this weekend was rescheduled to 10 a.m. Saturday, March 30.
The St. Lucie County government announced Friday the Mobile Rec and Roll event at Lawnwood Skate Park in Fort Pierce was canceled.
The Boynton Beach Police Department's Kids versus Field Day scheduled for Friday was postponed and is expected to be held on a to be determined date this summer.
The city of Jupiter's "Touch a Truck Spring Fling" even was canceled.
The city of Palm Beach Gardens' open swim on Friday was canceled, while the courts at the tennis and pickleball center are also closed.
Below is a list of all facilities that are closed because of inclement weather:
PGA National Softball Open swim and splash pad Lilac pickleball Courts Gardens Park Showcase Field Gardens District Park Multipurpose Top Headlines
